alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Inland Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT, CHARLESTON AND COLLETON COUNTIES... At 519 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ashepoo to near Dale, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Edisto Beach, Johns Island, James Island, Hollywood, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, and Kiawah Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Inland Colleton
